content.question: ​A decibel (dB) is a unit of measure for loudness of sound. The decibel scale is based in sound intensity <math alttext="N"><semantics><mi>N</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, in watts per square meter. A decibel value is given by the function <math alttext="d"><semantics><mi>d</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="d open parentheses N close parentheses equals 10 log subscript 10 open parentheses N over 10 to the power of negative 12 end exponent close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>d</mi><mfenced><mi>N</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mfrac><mi>N</mi><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></msup></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following gives all intensities <math alttext="N"><semantics><mi>N</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, in watts per square meter, for which the decibel value is greater than <math alttext="140"><semantics><mn>140</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> decibels?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="N greater than 14 times 10 to the power of negative 12 end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>></mo><mn>14</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="N greater than 10 to the power of 26"><semantics><mrow><mi>N</mi><mo>></mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>26</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.13: Exponential and Logarithmic Equations and Inequalities

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
